pull.title: BIP-322 support
pull.body: This is my WIP on BIP 322 support. It is based on the updated BIP which significantly changes how message signing is done.

committer Karl-Johan Alm <karljohan-alm@garage.co.jp> 1602754630 +0900

add framework for transaction proofs (BIP-322)

Initially the proofs are put into the signet.h/cpp files as they are reusing a lot of the functionality.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20480 (Replace boost::variant with std::variant by MarcoFalke)
* #20012 (rpc: Remove duplicate name and argNames from CRPCCommand by MarcoFalke)
* #19183 ([WIP DONOTMERGE] Replace boost with C++17 by MarcoFalke)
* #18466 (rpc: fix invalid parameter error codes for {sign,verify}message RPCs by theStack)
* #15129 (rpc: Added ability to remove watch only addresses by benthecarman)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.body:
The BIP is changing substantially. Will revisit when that's done.

@luke-jr Thanks for the feedback. Will take it into consideration.

comments.body: This might need rephrasing to avoid an attack where someone uses this to trick a user into "upgrading" to malware...
This is probably confusing to end users.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -276,6 +277,16 @@ static RPCHelpMan verifymessage()
                     {"address", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The bitcoin address to use for the signature."},
                     {"signature", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The signature provided by the signer in base 64 encoding (see signmessage)."},
                     {"message", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The message that was signed."},
+                    {"inputs", RPCArg::Type::ARR, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "UTXOs in a proof of funds",
comments.body: This should probably be an alternative to position 1 ("address"), and support a simpler "amount" usage.
Funds don't have addresses. This makes no sense.
Should probably have a simpler amount-only alternative.
